1.text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

2.text: To know wisdom and instruction; To comprehend the words of understanding;

3.text: To receive the discipline of wisdom, Justice, and right, and equity;

4.text: To give prudence to the simple, To the young man knowledge and discretion;

5.text: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning, And the man of understanding may attain unto wise counsels;

6.text: To understand a proverb, and a figure; The words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

7.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; But the foolish despise wisdom and discipline.

8.text: Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, And forsake not the teaching of thy mother;

9.text: For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head, And chains about thy neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, Consent thou not.

11.text: If they say: ‘Come with us, Let us lie in wait for blood, Let us lurk for the innocent without cause;

12.text: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave, And whole, as those that go down into the pit;

13.text: We shall find all precious substance, We shall fill our houses with spoil;

14.text: Cast in thy lot among us; Let us all have one purse’—

15.text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them, Restrain thy foot from their path;

16.text: For their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed blood.

17.text: For in vain the net is spread In the eyes of any bird;

18.text: And these lie in wait for their own blood, They lurk for their own lives.

19.text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; It taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

20.text: Wisdom crieth aloud in the streets, She uttereth her voice in the broad places;

21.text: She calleth at the head of the noisy streets, At the entrances of the gates, in the city, she uttereth her words:

22.text: How long, ye thoughtless, will ye love thoughtlessness? And how long will scorners delight them in scorning, And fools hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn you at my reproof; Behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

24.text: Because I have called, and ye refused, I have stretched out my hand, and no man attended,

25.text: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, And would none of my reproof;

26.text: I also, in your calamity, will laugh, I will mock when your dread cometh;

27.text: When your dread cometh as a storm, And your calamity cometh on as a whirlwind; When trouble and distress come upon you.

28.text: Then will they call me, but I will not answer, They will seek me earnestly, but they shall not find me.

29.text: For that they hated knowledge, And did not choose the fear of the LORD;

30.text: They would none of my counsel, They despised all my reproof.

31.text: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, And be filled with their own devices.

32.text: For the waywardness of the thoughtless shall slay them, And the confidence of fools shall destroy them.

33.text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely, And shall be quiet without fear of evil.’
